intro: Ozothamnus vagans, commonly known as the slender golden bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Ozothamnus vagans typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is drought-tolerant. It is often used in landscaping for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
